articles.headline: Colts' DeForest Buckner back from IR; Sauce Gardner out again
articles.description: The Colts are getting DT DeForest Buckner back from injured reserve but will be without CB Sauce Gardner again vs. the 49ers on Monday night.

articles.headline: Cowboys activate CB Trevon Diggs ahead of Chargers game
articles.description: The Cowboys activated Trevon Diggs off injured reserve on Saturday, giving the two-time Pro Bowl cornerback the opportunity to play Sunday against the Chargers.

images.name: Stephen A. declares Cowboys' season a failure
images.caption: Stephen A. Smith weighs in on the Cowboys' woes after their loss to the Vikings.

articles.headline: NFL Week 16 predictions, fantasy sleepers, QB notes, bets
articles.description: Fantasy upside for J.J. McCarthy and Tyler Shough? An advantage for the Bears' rushing attack? Upset brewing in Commanders-Eagles? Let's look at Week 16.
articles.byline: Matt Bowen, Pamela Maldonado, Eric Moody, Ben Solak, Seth Walder and NFL Nation

articles.headline: Lions understand it's win or go home the rest of the way
articles.description: Their playoff odds aren't the best, but the Lions say, "There's never a panic with us, we know what we need to do."

images.name: Matthew Stafford [608x342]
images.caption: The Lions surrendered 41 points in last week's loss the Los Angeles Rams.

images.name: Why Rich Eisen believes the Lions can still make the playoffs
images.caption: Rich Eisen believes the Lions can run the table and still make the playoffs despite losing to the Rams in Week 15.

articles.headline: What to make of Ashton Jeanty's rookie season
articles.description: How Raiders rookie Ashton Jeanty looked during the 2025 season, and what's next for the running back.

images.name: Ashton Jeanty running vs. Jags [608x342]
images.caption: "... He's done his job. We have to give him more opportunities and more space," coach Pete Carroll said of Ashton Jeanty.

images.name: Ashton Jeanty [608x342]
images.caption: Ashton Jeanty has rushed for 700 yards this season.

images.name: Raiders huddle [608x342]
images.caption: Against the Eagles last week, the Raiders' offense only totaled 75 yards.

images.name: Why Yates predicts Jeanty will score under 10 fantasy points
images.caption: Field Yates breaks down why he has Ashton Jeanty scoring under 10 fantasy points in Week 16.

articles.headline: How Bears DC Dennis Allen has created a takeaway machine
articles.description: The Bears lead the NFL in takeaways differential (plus-20), interceptions (21) and total takeaways (30). Here's why.

images.name: D'Marco Jackson #48 [1296x729]
images.caption: D'Marco Jackson (48) had been cut from the Saints and didn't know where he would land next. But Dennis Allen, who coached Jackson in New Orleans, knew he could help the Bears. Jackson was recently named NFC defensive player of the week.

images.name: Dennis Allen [1296x729]
images.caption: Allen has head coaching experience, and that helped him earn a level of trust among his players.

images.name: Pat McAfee: Are they still the Chicago Bears if they're in Indiana?
images.caption: Pat McAfee reacts to the Bears expanding their stadium search to the state of Indiana.

article.headline: Drake Maye leads Patriots to 23-20 win over Bills, leaving NFL without an unbeaten team
article.description: — Receiver Stefon Diggs is quite comfortable putting on a show in Buffalo. The big difference on Sunday night was doing so for the Bills’ division rival New England Patriots.
article.linkText: Drake Maye leads Patriots to 23-20 win over Bills, leaving NFL without an unbeaten team

images.name: Drake Maye completes incredible pass while being dragged down
images.caption: Drake Maye is able to hit Stefon Diggs while being taken to the ground, which give the Patriots a first down.

article.story: ORCHARD PARK, N.Y. -- — Receiver Stefon Diggs is quite comfortable putting on a show in Buffalo. The big difference on Sunday night was doing so for the Bills’ division rival New England Patriots. Diggs had 10 catches for 146 yards, with 119 coming in the second half, in a 23-20 win over the Bills sealed by Andy Borregales hitting a 52-yard field goal with 15 seconds remaining. In teaming up with quarterback Drake Maye and Rhamondre Stevenson, who scored two touchdowns rushing, the Patriots left the NFL without an undefeated team five weeks into the season. Diggs followed up his six-catch, 101-yard outing in in last week's 43-13 win over Carolina by topping it in the 31-year-old’s first return to Orchard Park, New York, since his four-year stint in Buffalo ended with him being traded to Houston in April 2024. “It was lit, prime time," said Diggs, who set nearly every single-season franchise receiving record in Buffalo during his four-year tenure. “It was electrifying. I knew it was going to be a test for us.” It’s a test the up-and-coming Patriots passed under Maye, the blossoming second-year starter, first-year coach Mike Vrabel and veteran running back Rhamondre Stevenson, who scored on 4- and 7-yard runs. The Patriots won back-to-back games for the first time since winning three in a row midway through the 2022 season. New England has a winning record through five games for the first time since opening the 2019 season 8-0. And the Patriots tightened the AFC East race by moving within one game of the five-time defending division champion Bills (4-1). Maye finished 22 of 30 for 273 yards, and was near-perfect in the second half by going 13 of 14 for 184 yards. No throw was more impressive than when he began the final drive by eluding the grasp of Bills defensive tackle DaQuan Jones and getting off a 12-yard completion to Diggs. “You know this was his storybook,” Maye said of the receiver who signed with New England in March, and after his time in Houston was cut short by a torn knee ligament last season. “Coming back here first game, prime time, you could see it all week. He just loves football,” Maye said. “He’s got a lot in the tank left, so it’s good he’s a Patriot.” The Bills essentially beat themselves in snapping a 14-game home winning streak that was one short of the franchise record and dated to a 24-22 loss to Denver on Nov. 13, 2023. The Bills had three turnovers, two by Allen. He muffed a handoff to tight end Dawson Knox to end Buffalo’s opening drive. Allen was also picked off by Marcus Jones at New England’s 10, with the Bills trailing 13-10. Receiver Keon Coleman lost a fumble at his own 11. “We just played sloppy. Not going to win a football game turning the ball over three times,” Allen said. “That’s just bad football. We just did not play good tonight.” Allen, last season’s MVP, finished 22 of 31 for 253 yards and threw touchdown passes to Coleman and Curtis Samuel. Turnovers weren’t the only issue as Buffalo was limited scoring 20 or fewer points for just the fourth time since the start of 2024. Before Borregales’ decisive kick, the Bills’ drive stalled at New England’s 28 and Buffalo settled for Matt Prater’s 45-yard field goal to tie the game with 2:17 left. “I thought we beat ourselves,” coach Sean McDermott said. “Just not enough complementary football. Just didn’t seem like we were into a rhythm offensively enough. And when we did, we had penalties, self-inflicted wounds early on in the game.” The Bills had 11 accepted penalties for 90 yards against them. Buffalo and Philadelphia entered the day as the NFL’s last unbeaten teams. The Eagles lost to visiting Denver. It’s the first time since 2014 and seventh time since the 1970 merger that no team has started 5-0. The Patriots’ defense limited James Cook to 49 yards on 15 carries. Cook was held under 100 yards from scrimmage for the first time this season, and his streak of eight games with a rushing touchdown was snapped. Injuries Patriots: RB Antonio Gibson did not return after sustaining a knee injury while returning a kickoff six minutes into the second quarter. Bills: C Connor McGovern returned after having tests on his hand. LB Matt Milano did not return after aggravating a pectoral injury that forced him to miss the previous two games. DT Ed Oliver missed his fourth straight game with a sprained ankle. Up next Patriots: Continue a three-game road swing at New Orleans next Sunday. Bills: Play at Atlanta in a Monday night game on Oct. 13. ------ AP NFL: https://apnews.com/hub/nfl
